result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tasha Lynn Hand

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Acalia N Halverson in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CT180 and 15CM525.

10:34 a.m.  Atty Knaapen calls case and states the appearances.
Court questions Atty Halverson as to where her client may be.
Atty Halverson has not had any recent contact with her client and was not expecting her to appear today.
Court makes statements regarding a previous warrant that had been quashed.

BY THE COURT:
Bench Warrant authorized for both cases 

11:10 a.m.  Case is recalled.
Atty Knaapen calls the case and restates the appearances.
Attorney Acalia N Halverson in court.   Defendant, Tasha Hand, appears in person.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BTC:  Court withdraws warrant authorized earlier on both cases 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Knaapen indicates that the restitution had been paid in full in the amount of $1,411.81.
State has complied with victim notification; no victim's appear in Court today.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT180:
Count 1 - No contest

15CM525:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CT180 and Count 1 of 15CM525 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CT180:
Count 1 -
Pay $300 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan - defendant to go to the Clerk of Court's Office today to set up payment plan 
Provide a DNA sample, if not already done so

15CM525:
Count 1 - DRI
Canceled per stip and order
Written Stipulation and Request to Quash Warrant and Court Order /s/TBE 11-21-16. Original filed in 15CT-180.
Original filed in 15CT-180
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture
cc:  DA w/minutes on 11/14/16 sp
Plea hearing on December 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
(resent to correct missed hearing date) 11-14-16 ss

Attorney Acalia N Halverson in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:15 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
Both files heard: 15CM525, 15CT180

Atty Halverson does not know where her client is. 
Atty Knaapen requests a warrant.  
Court reviews the files. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond ordered forfeited.  No cash was posted, however the defendant now owes the County the bond money ordered.  Bench warrant ordered in each file.
original filed in 15CT180

$350 Cash bond is now amended down to this signature bond.
All other conditions remain in full force and effect:  Comply with conditions of bond in 15CT180.
Written Stipulation and Request to Amend Bond and COURT ORDER /s/ TBE 10/03/16 - Bonds in 15CT180 & 15CM525 are to be amended to signature bonds.
Plea hearing on November 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
filed by Atty Acalia Halverson
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: original filed in 15CT180
Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Atty Acalia Halverson appointed
Pre-trial conference on September 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Bond amended from $500 signature bond to $350 cash bond. 
All other conditions remain in full force and effect:  Comply with conditions of bond in 15CT180.

ADDRESS INFO for Tasha Lynn Hand
Current: 1050 Fern Ave, Grand Marsh, WI 53936 United States  (Effective: 09-02-2016)
Prior: 5110 Main St 222, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Tasha Lynn Hand appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM525, 15CT180
1:47 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant makes statements. 

BY THE COURT:  Court vacates the warrants. 

Atty Knaapen recommends $350 in 15CM525 an additional $500 cash bond on 15CT180.

Court advises the defendant to speak to the Public Defender's office re: representation.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.
cc:  DA w/minutes 05/04/16 sp

Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CT-180 and 15CM-525.

10:43 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Atty Renc does not know where her client is.

State requests warrants in each file, body only.
$1,411.81 is restitution that is being requested.

Court reviews the files.

BY THE COURT:
Court authorizes warrant with $1,200 cash alternative in 15CT-180.
Court authorizes warrant with $300 cash alternative in 15CM-525.
Plea hearing at 05-04-2016 10:30 am
filed by the State
